contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} [[Image:Hamatama, Japan Sunset.jpg|thumbnail|200px|right|Sunset on the beach in Hamatama]] {{Nihongo|'''Hamatama'''|浜玉町|Hamatama-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Higashimatsuura District, Saga|Higashimatsuura District]], [[Saga Prefecture|Saga]], [[Japan]]. On January 1, 2005 Hamatama, along with the towns of [[Chinzei, Saga|Chinzei]], [[Hizen, Saga|Hizen]], [[Kyūragi, Saga|Kyūragi]], [[Ōchi, Saga|Ōchi]] and [[Yobuko, Saga|Yobuko]], and the village of [[Kitahata, Saga|Kitahata]], all from [[Higashimatsuura District, Saga|Higashimatsuura District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Karatsu, Saga|Karatsu]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 10,311 and a [[population density|density]] of 197.79 persons per km². The total area was 52.13 km². It is adjacent to the relatively well-known [[Nijinomatsubara]] pine tree forest, and borders the [[Sea of Japan]] with three miles of whitesand beach.
